headline: EXCLUSIVE: Glossier Names Colin Walsh CEO
summary: Walsh, who most recently helmed Procter & Gamble's beauty division earlier this year, will assume the post in October.

headline: 4 Consumer Product Stocks Showing Resilience Amid Market Headwinds
summary: Despite rising costs and shifting consumer trends, PG, CHD, OLLI and GO are demonstrating resilience by implementing strategic measures to sustain growth.

headline: 2025 Opportunities in the Global Skincare Sector with Forecasts to 2029 | Competitive Analysis of L'Oreal, Estee Lauder, Beiersdorf, Procter & Gamble, and Unilever
summary: Explore the future of skincare with comprehensive insights into ingredients, claims, and packaging across five key regions: Asia-Pacific, Americas, Europe, Middle East, and Africa. Valued at $163.9 billion in 2024, the sector is set to reach $191.5 billion by 2029. Uncover trends driving personalized and natural skincare demand, along with regional growth drivers and inhibitors. Understand competitive landscapes, consumer trends, and distribution dynamics in this in-depth analysis.Dublin, Sept.

headline: Diversity Action Alliance to Honor Industry Legends & Changemakers at 2025 G.E.M.S. Honors
summary: The Diversity Action Alliance (DAA) will host its annual G.E.M.S. Honors Reception: Purpose in Action on Wednesday, September 17, from 6:00 – 8:30 p.m. ET in NYC. Sponsored by Omnicom Public Relations Group (OPRG), this signature program celebrates the outstanding contributions of individuals shaping the future of communications through bold leadership, cultural insight, professional excellence, and a deep commitment to equity.

headline: What Recent Price Swings Could Mean for P&G’s True Value in 2025
summary: If you have ever added a few Procter & Gamble products to your cart and wondered whether you should do the same with its stock, you are not alone. With its household-brand-packed lineup, P&G tends to be a staple for both consumers and investors. But as comfortable as it may feel to buy what you know, when stock prices move up and down the way Procter & Gamble's have lately, it's only natural to pause and ask, what's next? So far this year, the company’s share price has slipped 5.2%, with a...
